title: Business Analyst
description:
Role Summary:

Business Analyst is responsible for the implementation of new initiatives within the Customer Care team and technical exposure to IPA (Intelligent Process Automation). The individual will work with the Operations Team to own the process to operationalize strategy as it relates to new products, scope of services and technology. The role provides input into Automation Support as it relates to IPA Bots, automation, efficiency, product growth and knowledge management. The individual works cross functionally across Product, Customer Care, Automation, Technology and GHX India.

Roles & Responsibilities:


Evaluating business processes, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions within Customer Operations
Get Trained on Intelligent Process Automation and collaborate with technical product team and customer support team.
Document existing and future business process flows across various systems
Gather and analyze data from various sources to support strategic decision-making.
Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of strategic initiatives.
Collaborate with different departments and teams to understand their needs, challenges, and opportunities.
Evaluate corporate systems initiatives and determine best method for implementation
Facilitate workshops and meetings to gather input and insights from stakeholders.
Create project plans, timelines, and milestones to facilitate initiative implementation.
Provide regular updates on the progress of strategic initiatives to relevant stakeholders.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of implemented initiatives, recommending adjustments and improvements as necessary.
Conduct scenario analysis to assess the impact of different variables on project outcomes.
Reporting on Power BI with the use of other Power Apps.


Required Skills:


Experience with CRM tools such as Salesforce
Experience in RPA (Robotic Process Automation), AI (Artificial Intelligence), API (Application Program Interface), DBMS, SQL, Microsoft Office Dynamics 365.
Proven experience as a business analyst or in a similar analytical role.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Project management experience is desirable.
Familiarity with business intelligence tools and data visualization techniques.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and across different functional areas.
Strategic thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
Data analysis: Proficiency in using data analysis tools like Excel, SQL, or BI tools to extract, analyze, and interpret data.
Process mapping: Ability to create process maps and diagrams to visualize business processes
Requirements elicitation: Strong skills in interviewing stakeholders, conducting workshops, and using various elicitation techniques.
Documentation: Ability to write clear, concise, and well-structured documentation, such as requirements specifications and process models.
Project management: Basic understanding of project management methodologies and tools.
Customer service orientation: A focus on providing excellent customer service and support.
Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing requirements and priorities.
Professional Use of Excel, Power BI, Tableau, Microsoft Office 365 applications, Power Automate & Power Apps is good to have.


Required Experience


BS. degree in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, or related discipline/experience, or a combination of education and related work experience
Experience in RPA (Robotic Process Automation), AI (Artificial Intelligence), API (Application Program Interface), DBMS - SQL, Microsoft Office Dynamics 365 (good to have) .
Experience in Healthcare, Supply Chain, Procurement / Customer Support is preferred.
2+ years' work experience as a Business Analyst / Operations Business Analyst.


GHX: It's the way you do business in healthcare

Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX) enables better patient care and billions in savings for the healthcare community by maximizing automation, efficiency and accuracy of business processes.

GHX is a healthcare business and data automation company, empowering healthcare organizations to enable better patient care and maximize industry savings using our world class cloud-based supply chain technology exchange platform, solutions, analytics and services. We bring together healthcare providers and manufacturers and distributors in North America and Europe - who rely on smart, secure healthcare-focused technology and comprehensive data to automate their business processes and make more informed decisions.

It is our passion and vision for a more operationally efficient healthcare supply chain, helping organizations reduce - not shift - the cost of doing business, paving the way to delivering patient care more effectively. Together we take more than a billion dollars out of the cost of delivering healthcare every year. GHX is privately owned, operates in the United States, Canada and Europe, and employs more than 1000 people worldwide. Our corporate headquarters is in Colorado, with additional offices in Europe.
